alert.note: Alert for Door (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 8:12PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW TO IMPACT DOOR COUNTY LATE TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING... ...ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE REGION WITH HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... .An upper level disturbance will bring a swath of 1 to 3 inches of snow to much of the region tonight into early Thursday. Lake-enhancement will bring higher amounts to Door County, where accumulations of 3 to 5 inches, locally higher, are anticipated. The snow will result in hazardous travel conditions late tonight into Thursday morning. A strengthening low pressure system will track from the mid-Mississippi Valley to the central Great Lakes from Friday morning through midday Saturday. The strong system will bring heavy snow and strong winds to the region. Probability of at least 6 inches of snow range from 70 to 90% across the Fox Valley and lakeshore areas, and from 50 to 70% across parts of central and far northeast Wisconsin. In addition, wind gusts could reach 45 mph or higher in the Fox Valley and lakeshore areas, where near-blizzard conditions are possible. Temperatures near to slightly above freezing could locally reduce snowfall totals right along the Lake Michigan shoreline. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 AM CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 and 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 12 inches possible. Winds could gust over 45 mph at times, resulting in considerable blowing and drifting snow and near-blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Door County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to 10 AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Friday morning through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, hazardous travel conditions will likely impact the Thursday morning commute. For the Winter Storm Watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, and result in near-blizzard conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines, leading to power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
